revised_title: Surface Chemistry Differences in T Lymphocytes of Varying Major Histocompatibility Haplotypes
tldr: The authors studied the surface chemistry of spleen T lymphocytes from mice with different major histocompatibility haplotypes. They found significant differences in the number of cationogenic amino groups on the surface of T lymphocytes with H-2f and H-2S haplotypes. This difference in surface chemistry could be responsible for the subtle differences in the immune response between these mice.
